meanings.definition: A large, smooth, dark surface for writing on with chalk.
meanings.sent1: The teacher wrote the math problem on the blackboard.
meanings.sent2: The students gathered around the blackboard to see the drawing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student pretended the blackboard was a magic portal.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a blackboard, filled with equations waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The blackboard stood silently, ready to capture the next lesson.

meanings.definition: A board painted black, used for writing or drawing with chalk.
meanings.sent1: The blackboard in the classroom was always covered in colorful drawings.
meanings.sent2: The children took turns writing their names on the blackboard.
meanings.sent3: The blackboard felt proud to display the students' creative work.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a blackboard, filled with memories etched in chalk.
meanings.sent5: The blackboard held the secrets of the classroom, waiting to be erased.
